message.content: Yes, the authors cite the creators of existing assets such as datasets and models by referencing the respective publications, for example, CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100 (Krizhevsky, 2009), FedRep (Collins et al., 2021), and FedAvg (McMahan et al., 2017). This demonstrates that they acknowledge the original work and properly attribute it.

Yes, the authors cite the creators of the existing assets they use in their experiments. They reference Collins et al. (2021), McMahan et al. (2017), Krizhevsky (2009), and other works for both datasets and methodologies that they compare their results with.

Yes, the authors cite the creators of the existing assets they use in their experiments. They reference the benchmarks and FL methods they compare their algorithm with, such as FedRep (Collins et al., 2021), FedAvg (McMahan et al., 2017), and CIFAR-10 / CIFAR-100 datasets (Krizhevsky, 2009).
